page.title: 01Deer Forest N Of Dunkeld
page.content: Topography-the southern edge of this block comprises the highland fault line, north of which the moors rise gradually to the Grampian Mountains, with only one minor road crossing between here and the border with highland region. This parish of Dunkeld and Dowally has been "deer forest" since the 18th century though it is increasingly managed at this, the southern end of the vast Atholl Estates, for commercial forestry. The River Tay cuts through the hills in an entranched flat bottomed valley which forms the western edge of the block. The trunk road (A9) and railway to Inverness and a B road follow through the gap, while the road from Dunkeld to Blairgowrie (A923) winds its way round the hills and just enters the SE corner of the block. Economy-although Dunkeld is a tourist
